saasi 1.0.0

    • Sampling Aware Ancestral State Inference

    Simulate a birth/death/sampling tree

    sim_bds_tree.Rd

    This tree can be passed to saasi, and will include speciation, extinction, sampling, and mutation events.

    sim_bds_tree(
  params_df,
  q_matrix,
  x0,
  max_taxa = 100,
  max_t = 100,
  include_extinct = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    params_df

    Data frame containing non-q parameters used in ancestral state reconstruction algorithm. Must have the following column names: state, prior, lambda, mu, and psi. The prior values refer to the baseline probabilities of the states (used at the root of the tree).

    Example:

    statepriorlambdamupsi
    11/330.021
    21/330.021
    31/330.021
    q_matrix

    Numeric q matrix used in ancestral state reconstruction algorithm. Row and column indices or names represent states.

    x0

    Natural number used as root state in the returned tree. Must be a state declared in params_df.

    max_taxa

    Maximum number of nodes allowed in the returned tree.

    max_t

    Maximum depth allowed in the returned tree.

    include_extinct

    Boolean declaring whether extinct taxa are included in the returned tree.

    Value

    A phylo phylogenetic tree (ape format).

    Contents

    Developed by Ivan Gill, Yexuan Song.
